meaningMnemonic: This is a single kanji with an い at the end, meaning you know it's probably an adjective. One of the meanings of 安 is <kanji>cheap</kanji>, so this is just that as an adjective, <vocabulary>cheap</vocabulary>. Time to go to a 100円 shop and get some 安い goods, ammiright?
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

"Would you like this item for <vocabulary>cheap</vocabulary>?" 

"<reading>YAASS</reading> (やす), please!"
